definition: to go back on one's word/to break one's promise/to be unfaithful/to be untrustworthy
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: Chinese never go back on his words like a rat.
sentences.chinese: 中國人不會言而無信像個小人。

sentences.english: What is government if words have no meaning?
sentences.chinese: 如果政府言而無信那還有什麼用？

sentences.english: You are a crook like everyone in town thinks you are. You're greedy.
sentences.chinese: 就像鎮上每個人說的那樣，你言而無信，還貪心。

sentences.english: Don't break your word if you want help.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要人幫助你，就不可言而無信。
